Detailed Description

Endpoints of a connection are derived from this virtual class. It provides callbacks to the different events that can happen on a network connection. The derived class is either instanciated manually for a connecting connection or crafted in a NetworkEndpointFactory in the case of a server socket.

Member Function Documentation

virtual void libnetworkd::NetworkEndpoint::dataRead ( const char *  buffer,
uint32_t  dataLength 
) [pure virtual]

This function is called, as soon as incoming data has been received on the connection. This function has to be implemented by all endpoints.

Parameters:
[in] buffer The data received.
[in] dataLength The lenght of the received data in bytes.

virtual void libnetworkd::NetworkEndpoint::dataSent ( uint32_t  length  )  [inline, virtual]

This function is called, once data has been successfully sent over the connection. The default implementation ignores this event.

Parameters:
[in] length The length of the data sent in bytes.
